title: My feelings about the non-black colours of Pentakill skills
body:
https://i.imgur.com/lC0Xb9x.jpg
[[Image source]](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/BIvqUUcE-an-edited-picture-how-the-updated-pentakill-sona-should-look-like)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5KjmIGzCVWA

Please Riot, make them BLACK. Is it really that hard? Pentakill Kayle looks really good, and you pulled it off with an all-black skin, just with some clever use of lighting and dark grey to make the different parts very easy to spot. I do not like the purple, blue or brown used for Karthus, Mordekaiser, Sona or Yorick. They look like members of other bands with other images, especially Sona and Yorick. The style is there, the colours are not. It does not feel like a band with a common theme.
Style: 10/10
Colouring: 2/10

Bring them back... BACK IN BLACK!
**#PentakillBackInBlack**

---

I'm not the only one with such an opinion:

replies.body: Not just black, they must be blacker than the blackest black, times infinity.
Metal is the only heartbeat I need baby.
Vanta black. Shame there's a guy hoarding the rights to it.
that's the coating that literally eats light right?

Pentakill should only work in black.








or really really dark gray.
I don't know why the many downvotes... does these people HAVE A CLUE about what METAL is?!
I don't usually log in but I must agree that black looks better and the darker theme should stay just as dark for the other members of Pentakill

Exactly why I hated the Sona retexture on her Pentakill skin.

Yes. SHE looks better. Fine. But blue/purple isn't black, and her splash clearly doesn't represent her in game skin colouration. Forums absolutely hated the retexture for this reason, and Riot still went on with it.

That, and a few other reasons, is why I rarely buy skins any more. I check them out either in-game or online, because splash arts are no longer an accurate representation of what you get.
if a splash art inaccuracy is the reason why someone hates a skin, thats retarded.

>  I do not like the purple, blue or brown used for Karthus, Mordekaiser, Sona or Yorick.

Well, everything is said here. I think it is a little close minded to think every metal band follow the black colour. Like, grim tones? Ok, mostly the case.
But only black? How about we accept we are in 2017 and a lot of metal bands use different color and you don't need to make every member in black to make them look metal?

Dark blue seem like a very good way to make sona more than the "Metal goth girl" stereotype.

But could it be darker? Hum, honestly I would say "yes".

But YOU WILL TAKE THAT RAINBOW SIR.

But it's a skin line, imo it's for exactly that "stereotypical" black metal theme, not some progressive mish-mash whatever. Maybe I'm just biased though cause I prefer black and don't feel like using this skin anymore with this look.

Hey everyone! 

First off, I want to thank you guys (and grills) for leaving your feedback in this and other threads on the boards. We had a discussion around the color of the dress after we debuted her on PBE. We saw feedback both for and against the color change, which is why we wanted to get together and take a look at her again. 

**TL;DR after our discussion:** We're going to roll with keeping her dress as-is

Basically, this is what we would have made Pentakill Sona look like if we had designed her based on the standards we have today. 

When we were working on her, we decided a blue tint was better because this is a semi reflective fabric, whether it's velvet, satin, or taffeta, the black would be reflecting color off. Also, the dark, dark blue separates everything and makes her an easier read in game; her etwahl and chains don't blend into her model and muddy things up from game height.

I realize this isn't the answer everyone is going to be hoping for, but I did want to provide some context, as having things change without any kind of reasoning (especially when it's something you like) sucks.

You should offer a refund to everyone who bought this skin if you're not going to change it back to being black. This isn't what they bought and frankly it actually looks worse than before the update due to your refusal to make a simple change.

We don't offer selective refunds for updated/modified content, unfortunately - this goes for both updated skins, and champions that undergo a champion update.  Currently, we only refund content via refund tokens, and content that was purchased within the last 90 days.

> [{quoted}](name=LankPants,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AkM8wKYE,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-07-29T00:48:48.086+0000)
>
> You should offer a refund to everyone who bought this skin if you're not going to change it back to being black. This isn't what they bought and frankly it actually looks worse than before the update due to your refusal to make a simple change.

Wouldn't be the first time. Desparado Cassiopeia is the most egregious offense when it comes to dramatically changing a skins colors. It went from a black, silver and gold tail to muddy brown

**_Basically, this is what we would have made Pentakill Sona look like if we had designed her based on the standards we have today._**
Then how do you explain Pentakill Kayle? She is all black, save for some very dark grey and some neat highlights where there is not actual metal. Why can't you do the same for the rest of the skins? I would be fine with Sona's skin if you gave her a black dress with blue or purple highlights in the form of reflections, but you chose a blue dress. It looks out of place. You simply fail to deliver on the theme. I am extremely dissatisfied with your direction. It is as weird as making a Shadow Lord Shen skin, and have it bright pink. Do you not see the problem? It is too bright and colourful. The dress looks good if one views it objectively, but it does not fit the skin theme, and thereby looks bad in that context.

**_When we were working on her, we decided a blue tint was better because this is a semi reflective fabric, whether it's velvet, satin, or taffeta, the black would be reflecting color off. Also, the dark, dark blue separates everything and makes her an easier read in game; her etwahl and chains don't blend into her model and muddy things up from game height._**
The problem is that It is not simply a tint, but an all blue dress. I get no impression that black is involved at all. As stated above: why not use highlights in the form of actual reflections instead of all blue? It would make it more interesting too. And if you want to separate everything better, why on earth did you choose a hue for the chains that is so close to her dress'? They should be greyer or have the same kind of shiny highlights that you used for Pentakill Kayle's wings.

**_I realize this isn't the answer everyone is going to be hoping for, but I did want to provide some context, as having things change without any kind of reasoning (especially when it's something you like) sucks._**
You could at least make some all-black chromas for the Pentakill skins? That way you earn more money and satisfy all.

Why do you choose to make a change that goes against the theme? That is my question, because I know the artist team is skilled enough to do some changes that maintain both the black theme and clarity.
